positive: Overall, the process was clear and straightforward and matched or improved upon other digital government experiences.
Participants were clear about the direction the process was going in. If in doubt, the content on the page assured them what was going on.
It was uncomplicated and put participants at ease.
negative: It is important to provide users with contact details for court staff (whether phone number or webchat). This is a common need uncovered during every round of testing.
Having further guidance at each decision point will help users ensure they have enough knowledge to make an informed choice.

journeys.name: Defendant is informed of writ of control being issued and engages with service
userQuotes: It just seems so easy you could probably do it on your own.
You can do this without a solicitor!
It cuts out lots of the paperwork...
This [guidance] information needs be earlier - itâ€™s important to hear even if I didn't get to this stage.
journeys.description: User receives notification of Writ of Control and engages with the service for the first time. They proceed to apply to stay the Writ of Control.
changeLog: updated dashboard with stay a writ as next step
additional content to clarify that stay a writ application is completed but not yet confirmed
